Reviews.Title: “GREAT budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rnbnut
Reviews.Content: Location, price, (basic) amenities, this is the place. Not a resort hotel! Yes, you only get 2 towels. Enough for us. Plus good a/c, balcony overlooking the water, steps from the town square, ferry, and 5th Ave, refrig., and the front desk guys DO speak English. We paid $50/night for this! We absolutely LOVE Playa Del Carmen, will be staying here again. As of 2009, there is no evidence of hurricane damage. There are plenty of Americanized resort hotels around PDC, but none are going to be this convenient to the heart of the city like the Molcas. This hotel is for those who want to immerse themselves in the vibrant soul of PDC, the music, the people, the food, the city. From an incredibly conveniently located hotel home base. My recommendation for any visitor to PDC: follow your senses. Take a stroll down 5th Ave. See something interesting? Explore it. Hear good music? Take the time to stop and spend time there. Smell a wafting scent? Follow your nose for a delicious repast. You can enjoy a warm day at the beach, then dinner and dancing in the evening. The shopping is world class, but there's so much more. Instead of being bothered by the persistent hawkers, take a second to stop and banter. Even just a polite recognition and 'no thanks' is fine.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but clean!”
Reviews.Author: jtelfer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 years ago, right after the hurricanes (Rita, Wilma). Not much has changed. The place is still old and a bit worn, but worth the $60/night for a room. It's clean, somewhat comfortable, and aside from the lack of towels and water pressure, everything you need in a room is there. The hotel staff is among the nicest I have ever encountered. They don't speak english, so that's an issue if you don't speak spanish, but they couldn't have done more for our group than they did. WAY beyond the call of duty. I will stay here again with my students. You can't beat the value for the room and proximity to 5th avenue, Senor Frogs, Carlos & Charlies, and of course, the ferry to Cozumel. Incredible! No frills says it all, but if you are looking for a clean room with wonderfully nice people...this is your place. Just bring your own towels and soap!

Reviews.Title: “Damaged by Hurricane - Not Habitable”
Reviews.Author: Mishita
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here!!! We were told by the Molcas that the hotel was repaired after the hurricane and was fully operational except for the restaurant. The hotel is not habitable and we had to move to another hotel. The balconies are blown off and, if you can get your sliding glass door open, you step off into thin air two stories above the street. There is so much mold in this hotel that you can't breathe. One room had green algae growing down the walls. Another room given to our group had water seeping out of the bathroom wall, running across the floor, and out the door. The water pump for the hotel water supply failed while we were there and we couldn't bathe or flush the toilets. We called our tour company and got our money back but not before we had a very bad experience here. This hotel is too badly damaged from the hurricane and will have to be torn down. We repeat: it is NOT habitable since the hurricane.

Reviews.Title: “From the outside it looked OK, but”
Reviews.Author: Treesah
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night only. Central location was important. The pluses: air conditioning worked well, they had a small refrigerator, the bathroom was clean and the water pressure in the shower was fine. The minuses: poorly maintained, stained tiles, cracked sliding glass door, the door in the room could not be locked, the door leading to the balcony did not lock. We were given a different room and it was better but did not have a security lock on the door. The hotel was noisy being on a busy street. The receptionist was surly. You did not feel welcome at all. This hotel used to be very, very nice. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Try another place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Molcas on many occasions with groups we bring to the area. It used to be a great place, but is apparently under new management. Last time we stayed they shorted us a room. No help from bellboys, nobody speaks English. Rooms aren't as clean as they used to be. Noisy club near hotel. We've found a new place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: misspriss01
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms, great staff, and is budget-friendly. I plan to stay at the Molcas again my next trip to Playa!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Molcas on many occasions. Nice and clean with nice pool and restaurant. Closest hotel to the ferry over to Cozumel, I believe. We'll stay again!

Reviews.Title: “cheap but clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights this spring before heading to Cozumel. Found to rooms to be very clean and the staff was very nice. The location was great , it being near the ferry dock and near town.
